newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha firms as refinery maintenance looms.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha firms as refinery maintenance looms.

text.p: NWE naphtha was firm on Friday as tight supplies in the Mediterranean combined with imminent refinery maintenance in Northern Europe, traders said.
Refinery run cuts, too, could boost demand for high N+A grades for use in reforming, they said.
September swaps firmed by $2.00 to $196.00 per tonne and the Sept/Oct spread was bid at $4.00.
A few small cargoes were available from northern refiners, but Mediterranean supplies were tight after heavy buying from Brazil in addition to Algerian refinery maintenance.
